citations.narrative:
* The USDA Program of Veterinary Care form 7002 A is not being followed for 44 dogs. Under section B “Parasite Control
Program” it states under Ectoparasites that Ivermec will be given twice a year as a pour on to the adult dogs. Review of
the medical records show that no Ivermec has been given to the dogs. The program of veterinarian care establishes
standards of care for the animals. Medical records provide information that the program of veterinary care is being
followed and when contact with the attending veterinarian is needed. It shows what treatments and treatment dates have
been provided to the dogs. The licensee stated that the dogs are receiving Ivermec twice a year but failed to have a
record of the treatment and treatment dates in their medical records. The licensee must keep a record of all treatments
administered and the dates of administration. These records must be made available to APHIS officials upon request.
Correct by 10/8/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
* The USDA Program of Veterinary Care form 7002 A is not being followed for 44 dogs. Under section B “Parasite Control 
Program” it states under Ectoparasites that Ivermec will be given twice a year as a pour on to the adult dogs. Review of 
the medical records show that no Ivermec has been given to the dogs. The program of veterinarian care establishes 
standards of care for the animals. Medical records provide information that the program of veterinary care is being 
followed and when contact with the attending veterinarian is needed. It shows what treatments and treatment dates have 
been provided to the dogs. The licensee stated that the dogs are receiving Ivermec twice a year but failed to have a 
record of the treatment and treatment dates in their medical records. The licensee must keep a record of all treatments 
administered and the dates of administration. These records must be made available to APHIS officials upon request. 
Correct by 10/8/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
